translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions in the Dhammasanganī
The Triad on the Wholesome, the Triad on Applied Thought

original: Kusalaṁ savitakkasavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasavitakkasavicāro dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: kusalam sa vitakka sa vicāram dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a wholesome, accompanied-by-concomitants, accompanied-by- applied-thought, accompanied-by-sustained-thought, state as condition, a wholesome, unaccompanied-by-concomitants, unaccompanied-by- applied-thought, unaccompanied-by-sustained-thought, state arises.

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate
analyzed: hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate
translated: Conditioned by root cause. (Abbreviated.) In the case of root cause, there are thirteen; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of kamma result, three; … in the case of dissociation, thirteen.

original: terasa. (Kusale pañca, akusale pañca, abyākate tīṇi.)🔽Kusalaṁ avitakkavicāramattaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naavitakkavicāramatto dhammo
analyzed: terasa kusale pañca akusale pañca abyākate tīṇi  kusalam a vitakka vicāra mattam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammo
translated: (In the case of the wholesome, there are five; in the case of the unwholesome, five; in the case of the indeterminate, three.)🔽With a wholesome, unaccompanied-by-concomitants, accompanied-by- sustained-thought-only, state as condition, a wholesome, unaccompanied- by-concomitants, accompanied-by-sustained-thought-only, state arises.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi🔽…pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi  pe a vigate terasa
translated: Conditioned by root cause. (Abbreviated.) In the case of root cause, there are thirteen; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of kamma result, three; … in the case of dissociation, thirteen.

original: Kusalaṁ avitakkaavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naavitakkaavicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalam avitakka avicāram dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a wholesome, unaccompanied-by-concomitants, unaccompanied-by- applied-and-sustained-thought, state as condition, a wholesome, unaccompanied-by-concomitants, unaccompanied-by-applied-and-sustained- thought, state arises. Conditioned by root cause. … There are three.

original: Abyākataṁ avitakkaavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naavitakkaavicāro dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: abyākatam avitakka avicāram dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na avitakka avicāraḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: A wholesome, non-perplexing, neither-perception-nor-non-perception mind element arises in dependence on a non-perplexing, neither-perception-nor-non-perception mind-consciousness element.

original: hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetu paccayā tīṇi saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to cause as condition: there are three. (In brief.) With respect to cause, there are six; with respect to predominance, there are six; … with respect to kamma result, there are three; … with respect to the unobscured undiscerned, there are six.
